page.title: 12Longridge Estate
page.content: Beautiful trees and rhodedendrons,and the house faced South,looking out over Murton Crags.East and west Lodges were built at the ends of the long driveways,with excellent stable accom- odation,and a good house for the head-gardener. Sir Hubert Jerningham was Member of Parliament for the Borough of Berwick- upon -Tweed,and he was the last person to hold this post before the constituency was enlarged to include the country area around Berwick. After the death of Lady Jerningham a marble statue was erected in her memory and placed in Bankhill,Berwick, where it stands today,one of the few reminders of the Jerninghams.In 1920 the Longridge Estate was broken up and sold by auction in the Corn Exchange, Berwick on Sept 20th.
